result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerrail D Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Concurrent with: Case 15CF390, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Case 15CF390.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with the victims (M. K. and S. K.) or their residence or the co-actor (E. F.).

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 30 DAYS - Nonworking hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber by 06:00 p.m. on 02-14-2016.
LAST 60 DAYS - STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion.
Court will allow Condition Time to be served in Milwaukee County.

records.addlTxt: filed by Attorney Carson requesting the Court reconsider revoking the defendant's huber privileges for the balance of his sentence.
Defendant's Huber Privileges are hereby revoked for the balance of the sentence.
Letter from Jail Administration requesting huber privileges be revoked for defendant.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Jerrail D Wilson in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  4.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
Concurrent to 15CF390
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 3.5 Years.
Concurrent to:  15CF390
Court will allow for transfer to Miwaukee County.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  
Victims (M.K. & S.K) or their residence or Co-Actor (E.F.).
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to serve the first 30 Days.
Defendant to report to Huber by 6:00 pm. by Sunday 02/14/16.
Last 60 Days STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  
Court will allow to be served in Milwaukee County.


IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jerrail D Wilson in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant entered a plea of no contest to count 1. Court conducted plea colloquy with defendant. 
Court found defendant guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jerrail D Wilson in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Jerrail D Wilson in court with attorney Samuel Benedict for attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with any co-actor or the victim/witnesses or their residence  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Jerrail D Wilson in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
